Package com.ee364project

Class Call

java.lang.Object
com.ee364project.Call
All Implemented Interfaces:
Simulated
public class Call extends Object implements Simulated
The Call class represents a simulated call in a call center. It encapsulates information about the call, including its state, participants (caller and receiver), duration, and associated UI elements. This class implements the Simulated interface, providing a method for simulation steps to manage the call's lifecycle. The class includes static fields to manage call states, a checkbox associated with the call in the UI, a timeline for call duration, and various lists to store sentences, lengths, and speakers for the call's dialogues. Fields:
  • CallState: An enumeration representing the possible states of a call.
  • CheckBox checkBox: The checkbox associated with the call in the UI.
  • VBox vBox: The VBox container for UI elements.
  • HashMap<CheckBox, Call> CheckBoxAndCall: A mapping between checkboxes and calls.
  • long MAXWAITTIME: The maximum wait time for a call.
  • LinkedList<Call> activeCalls: A list of currently active calls.
  • LinkedList<Call> callQueue: A queue of calls waiting to be answered.
  • LinkedList<Call> callsToRemove: A list of calls to be removed.
  • ArrayList<String> sentences: A list of sentences exchanged during the call.
  • ArrayList<Integer> lengthsSaved: A list of lengths corresponding to each sentence.
  • ArrayList<Person> speaker: A list of speakers for each sentence.
  • long callCount: A count of created calls.
  • Phaser phaser: A phaser for synchronization.
  • HashMap<CheckBox, DialogeBox> linkCBtoDB: A mapping between checkboxes and dialogue boxes.
  • int startTime: The start time of the call.
  • int endTime: The end time of the call.
  • int answerTime: The time when the call was answered.
  • int totalTime: The total duration of the call.
  • Customer caller: The customer initiating the call.
  • Agent receiver: The agent receiving the call.
  • CallState state: The current state of the call.
  • CallCenter callCenter: The associated call center.
  • boolean newThreadAdded: A flag indicating if a new thread was added.
  • Timeline callTime: A timeline for call duration.
  • Text callNumber: The text element displaying the call number.

  • Constructor Details

    • Call

      public Call(Customer caller)
      Constructor for the Call class, representing a phone call initiated by a customer. Creates a new Call instance with the specified customer as the caller. The constructor initializes various attributes, such as start time, end time, and state, and adds the call to the call queue. It also creates GUI components and adds them to the application's user interface for visual representation.
      Parameters:
      caller - The customer initiating the call.

      The Text instance representing the call number.

    • getActiveCalls

      public static LinkedList<Call> getActiveCalls()
      Retrieves a LinkedList containing the active call instances. This method is used to obtain a LinkedList that contains the currently active call instances. The returned list provides access to information about ongoing calls and can be used to iterate over the active calls or perform other operations on them.
      Returns:
      A LinkedList containing the active call instances.

    • getLinkBetweenCheckBoxesAndDialoge

      public static HashMap<javafx.scene.control.CheckBox,DialogeBox> getLinkBetweenCheckBoxesAndDialoge()
      Retrieves a HashMap linking CheckBox instances to associated DialogeBox instances. This method returns a HashMap that establishes a link between CheckBox instances and their corresponding DialogeBox instances. The CheckBoxes are used to control or represent certain actions, and the associated DialogeBoxes provide additional information or interaction for each CheckBox.
      Returns:
      A HashMap linking CheckBox instances to associated DialogeBox instances.

    • getLinkBetweenCheckBoxesAndCalls

      public static HashMap<javafx.scene.control.CheckBox,Call> getLinkBetweenCheckBoxesAndCalls()
      Retrieves a HashMap linking CheckBox instances to associated Call instances. This method returns a HashMap that establishes a link between CheckBox instances and the corresponding Call instances. The CheckBoxes may represent specific actions or states, and the associated Call instances provide information about calls associated with each CheckBox.
      Returns:
      A HashMap linking CheckBox instances to associated Call instances.

    • getACall

      public static Call getACall()
      Retrieves and dequeues a Call instance from the call queue. This method retrieves and removes the head of the call queue, updating the state of the caller and the call itself. If the queue is empty, it returns null. The caller's state is set to Customer.CustomerState.INCALL, and the call state is set to Call.CallState.INCALL after dequeuing the call.
      Returns:
      A Call instance representing the dequeued call, or null if the queue is empty.

    • getTimeElapsed

      public int getTimeElapsed()
      Calculates and retrieves the elapsed time since the start of an operation. This method calculates the time elapsed in milliseconds between the current time obtained from Timekeeper.getTime() and the start time set during the initialization of the operation.
      Returns:
      The elapsed time in milliseconds.

    • makeLinkedList

      public LinkedList<Solution> makeLinkedList(Customer caller)
      Creates a linked list of solutions associated with the last problem of a customer. This method takes a customer as a parameter, retrieves the last problem from the customer's problem information, and creates a linked list of solutions associated with that problem. The solutions are obtained from the last problem's solutions list and added to the linked list.
      Parameters:
      caller - The customer for whom the linked list of solutions is created.
      Returns:
      A linked list of solutions associated with the last problem of the customer.

    • getEndTime

      public long getEndTime()
      Retrieves the end time associated with an operation. This method returns the end time of an operation, represented in milliseconds since the epoch. The end time is a value that indicates when the operation was completed or when the end time was explicitly set.
      Returns:
      The end time of the operation in milliseconds since the epoch.

    • connectCall

      public void connectCall(CallCenter callCenter)
      Connects the current call in the call center simulation. This method performs various actions to set up and manage the connected call, including removing the call from the call queue, assigning a level to the receiver based on the last problem, creating a dialogue, and updating call-related attributes.
      Parameters:
      callCenter - The call center instance where the call is being connected.

    • addLine

      public void addLine(String sentenceString, Person person, int length)
      Adds a line of dialogue to the conversation log. This method appends a sentence, the corresponding speaker, and the length of the sentence to the conversation log. Each parameter is added to its respective list, maintaining the order of the conversation.
      Parameters:
      sentenceString - The string representing the dialogue line to be added.
      person - The person who delivered the dialogue.
      length - The length of the sentence, typically measured in characters or words.

    • terminateCall

      public void terminateCall()
      Terminates the current call and performs cleanup operations. This method is responsible for ending the call, updating various parameters, and performing cleanup tasks.

    • terminateCalls

      public static void terminateCalls()
      Terminates multiple calls and performs cleanup operations. This method iterates through a list of calls to be terminated, invokes the terminateCall() method for each call, and clears the list of calls to be removed. Note: This method assumes the existence of certain classes and methods, such as terminateCall(), LinkedList.clear().

    • getCallDuration

      public long getCallDuration()
      Calculates and retrieves the duration of the call. This method calculates the duration of the call by subtracting the answer time from the end time. The result represents the time elapsed during the call.
      Returns:
      The duration of the call in milliseconds.

    • getStartTime

      public long getStartTime()
      Retrieves the start time of the call. This method returns the time at which the call was initiated, represented in milliseconds since the epoch. The start time indicates when the call was started.
      Returns:
      The start time of the call in milliseconds since the epoch.

    • getAnswerTime

      public long getAnswerTime()
      Retrieves the time at which the call was answered. This method returns the time at which the call was answered, represented in milliseconds since the epoch. The answer time indicates when the call was picked up or accepted.
      Returns:
      The time at which the call was answered in milliseconds since the epoch.

    • getWaitTime

      public long getWaitTime()
      Calculates and retrieves the wait time of the call. This method calculates the wait time of the call, which is the duration the call spent in the waiting state before being answered or ending. If the call has ended, the wait time is calculated from the start time to the answer time. Otherwise, it is calculated from the start time to the current time.
      Returns:
      The wait time of the call in milliseconds.

    • getCaller

      public Customer getCaller()
      Retrieves the customer associated with the call. This method returns the customer who initiated the call. The caller is an instance of the Customer class, representing the individual making the phone call.
      Returns:
      The customer associated with the call.

    • getReceiver

      public Agent getReceiver()
      Retrieves the agent assigned to handle the call. This method returns the agent assigned to handle the call. The receiver is an instance of the Agent class, representing the individual responsible for managing the call. If the call has not been assigned to an agent, the method returns null.
      Returns:
      The agent assigned to handle the call, or null if not assigned.

    • setReciever

      public void setReciever(Agent agent)
      Sets the agent to handle the call. This method assigns the specified agent to handle the call. The agent, an instance of the Agent class, represents the individual responsible for managing the call.
      Parameters:
      agent - The agent to be assigned to handle the call.

    • getState

      public Call.CallState getState()
      Retrieves the current state of the call. This method returns the current state of the call, represented by an instance of the Call.CallState enum. The call state provides information about the current status or stage of the call, such as whether it's waiting, in progress, ended, or expired.
      Returns:
      The current state of the call.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the call for debugging or logging purposes. This method generates a string that includes the call identifier, caller information, and the duration of the call. The result is intended for debugging, logging, or other informational purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the call.

    • step

      public void step()
      Performs a single step or iteration of the call's lifecycle. This method advances the state of the call based on its current state and other conditions. If the call is currently in the Call.CallState.INCALL state and the end time has been reached, the state is updated to Call.CallState.ENDED, and the call is added to the list of calls to be removed. The method also checks for calls in the waiting state that have exceeded the maximum waiting time using applyExpiry().
      Specified by:
      step in interface Simulated

    • getCheckBox

      public javafx.scene.control.CheckBox getCheckBox()
      Retrieves the CheckBox associated with the call. This method returns the CheckBox instance associated with the call. The CheckBox is a graphical user interface component used to represent or control the state of the call in the user interface.
      Returns:
      The CheckBox associated with the call.

    • getLengths

      public ArrayList<Integer> getLengths()
      Retrieves the list of saved lengths associated with the call's dialogue lines. This method returns an ArrayList of integers representing the lengths of dialogue lines associated with the call. Each integer corresponds to the length of a sentence spoken during the call.
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of integers representing the lengths of dialogue lines.

    • getSentences

      public ArrayList<String> getSentences()
      Retrieves the list of sentences associated with the call's dialogue. This method returns an ArrayList of strings representing the sentences spoken during the call. Each string corresponds to a sentence in the call's dialogue.
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of strings representing the sentences in the call's dialogue.

    • getSentences

      public String getSentences(int i)
      Retrieves a specific sentence from the list of sentences associated with the call's dialogue. This method returns the sentence at the specified index in the list of sentences spoken during the call. The index parameter represents the position of the desired sentence.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the sentence to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The sentence at the specified index in the call's dialogue.

    • getlengths

      public int getlengths(int i)
      Retrieves the length of a specific sentence from the list of dialogue lengths. This method returns the length of the sentence at the specified index in the list of dialogue lengths associated with the call. The index parameter represents the position of the desired sentence's length.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the sentence length to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The length of the sentence at the specified index in the call's dialogue.

    • getPerson

      public Person getPerson(int i)
      Retrieves the person associated with a specific sentence in the call's dialogue. This method returns the person (speaker) associated with the sentence at the specified index in the list of speakers associated with the call. The index parameter represents the position of the desired sentence's speaker.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the speaker to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The person associated with the sentence at the specified index in the call's dialogue.
